summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing the scheduling of a meeting and the exchange of legal documents related to Ghislaine Maxwell's suppression motions in her criminal case. The emails attach briefs, transcripts, and exhibits concerning motions to suppress evidence obtained from a subpoena to a financial institution (BSF).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the suppression motions and the upcoming criminal trial. Her defense filed briefs to suppress evidence.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge overseeing the Maxwell case who stated she will resolve the suppression motions 'at a later time' ahead of trial.

persons.name: McMahon
persons.context: A judge referenced in the context of proceedings; a transcript of her proceedings and opinion is attached as an exhibit.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judge in Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal case and will rule on her defense's suppression motions.

events.title: Email exchange regarding suppression motions
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel exchange emails to schedule a meeting and share legal documents related to Maxwell's pending suppression motions.

events.title: Upcoming suppression hearing
events.description: A suppression hearing related to Maxwell's case is expected to be scheduled, though no date is set at the time of this correspondence.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense filed motions to suppress evidence obtained from a subpoena to a financial institution (referred to as BSF).
Judge Nathan, the presiding judge, has indicated she will resolve the suppression motions 'at a later time' ahead of trial.
The email attaches multiple legal documents including Maxwell's suppression briefs, a transcript of proceedings before Judge McMahon, the government's opposition brief, and confidential exhibits.
The correspondence is between personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, coordinating on the Maxwell case.
